Welcome to your next lesson on practical Japanese, where we will focus on asking for information and understanding announcements at the airport.
To start, if you want to ask "Where is the information desk?", you say

lang.mstts:prosody: 情報デスクはどこですか？

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Once more, for "Where is the information desk?" you say,

lang.mstts:prosody: 情報デスクはどこですか？

.

Often at the airport, you'll hear announcements like "The flight to Tokyo is boarding at gate 5." To understand this, you need to listen out for phrases like

lang.mstts:prosody: 東京行きのフライトはゲート5で搭乗します。

Another common announcement might be "The flight to Kyoto has been delayed." In Japanese, it's

lang.mstts:prosody: 京都行きのフライトが遅延しました。

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Again, "The flight to Kyoto has been delayed." is translated as

lang.mstts:prosody: 京都行きのフライトが遅延しました。

With this, you can now ask for the time, locate the information desk, and understand crucial announcements at the airport. Remember to revisit these phrases and practice them for fluency. Keep it up with your Japanese studies!
